intro: Styphelia acerosa, commonly known as the hard-leaved greenbrier, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by dark blue berries. Styphelia acerosa thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of southeastern U.S. ecosystems.
